messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Bakufu
messages.msgSnippet: Politics in the Tokugawa Bakufu by Conrad Totman covers the subject admirably. You might find a copy in the local library. I was pleasantly surprised to find
messages.messageBody:
"Politics in the Tokugawa Bakufu" by Conrad Totman covers the subject admirably. You might find a copy in the local library. I was pleasantly surprised to find the one I used in Fred Notehelfer's class at UCLA is now worth $50!!!!

papill_on99 <tihanap@...> wrote:

Thanx, Angus I will check it out!

messages.subject: RE: [samuraihistory] Bakufu
messages.msgSnippet: I d recommend William Wayne Farris book Heavenly Warriors for information on the formation of the Kamakura Bakufu. For the Ashikaga Bakufu I d recommend
messages.messageBody:
I'd recommend William Wayne Farris' book "Heavenly Warriors" for
information on the formation of the Kamakura Bakufu. For the Ashikaga
Bakufu I'd recommend Sansom's "A History of Japan: 1334-1615".

I haven't read a lot on the Tokugawa Bakufu, but Sansom's "A History of
Japan: 1615-1867" probably covers it nicely, as well.

All of these books should be relatively easy to track down, and all are
listed on Amazon.com

HTH,

Angus
